title: AgentVerse 4-Stage Workflow
description: Complete AgentVerse implementation with dynamic expert recruitment, collaborative decision-making, action execution, and iterative evaluation.

1_expert_recruitment.name: Expert Recruitment
1_expert_recruitment.description: Dynamically determine and adjust agent group composition based on the task

roles.description: Breaks down tasks into subtasks with dependencies
Analyzes problems and suggests efficient approaches
roles.when_to_use: Tasks requiring domain knowledge or research

roles.description: Performs calculations and executes specific actions
roles.when_to_use: Tasks requiring concrete computations or actions

roles.description: Verifies results and flags errors or inconsistencies
roles.when_to_use: Tasks requiring quality control and validation

2_collaborative_decision.name: Collaborative Decision-Making
2_collaborative_decision.description: Agents engage in discussion to decide on the approach

horizontal.description: Democratic structure where all agents share and refine decisions

vertical.description: Solver proposes, reviewers critique, solver refines

3_action_execution.name: Action Execution
3_action_execution.description: Agents execute collaboratively-decided actions in parallel

4_evaluation.name: Evaluation
4_evaluation.description: Assess results and provide feedback for iteration

example_tasks.name: Mathematical Problem
example_tasks.task: A school is designing a small amusement park with three rides. The first ride costs $500 to build and makes $20 per ride. The second ride costs $700 and makes $25 per ride. The third ride costs $900 and makes $30 per ride. The school has a budget of $2000 and wants to maximize revenue in 1 day if 100 students ride each ride at most once. Determine which rides to build and calculate the expected total revenue.

example_tasks.name: Research Task
example_tasks.task: Research the current state of quantum computing and its potential applications in cryptography. Provide a comprehensive summary with key findings and recommendations.

example_tasks.name: Software Development
example_tasks.task: Design and implement a Python calculator with a graphical user interface that supports basic arithmetic operations, keyboard input, and error handling.

example_tasks.name: Consulting
example_tasks.task: Provide recommendations for a startup looking to implement AI-powered customer service. Consider cost, scalability, user experience, and implementation timeline.

positive.name: Volunteer Behaviors
positive.description: Agents offer assistance to peers, improving team efficiency

positive.name: Conformity Behaviors
positive.description: Agents adjust deviated behaviors to align with common goals under peer critique

concerning.name: Destructive Behaviors
concerning.description: Agents may take shortcuts that raise safety concerns
concerning.mitigation: Implement safety constraints and human oversight
